1.text: And when the sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, had bought sweet spices, that they might come and anoint him.

2.text: And very early in the morning the first day of the week, they came to the sepulcher at the rising of the sun.

3.text: And they said among themselves, Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulcher?

4.text: And when they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away: for it was very great.

5.text: And entering into the sepulcher, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white garment; and they were affrighted.

6.text: And he said to them, Be not affrighted: You seek Jesus of Nazareth, which was crucified: he is risen; he is not here: behold the place where they laid him.

7.text: But go your way, tell his disciples and Peter that he goes before you into Galilee: there shall you see him, as he said to you.

8.text: And they went out quickly, and fled from the sepulcher; for they trembled and were amazed: neither said they any thing to any man; for they were afraid.

9.text: Now when Jesus was risen early the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had cast seven devils.

10.text: And she went and told them that had been with him, as they mourned and wept.

11.text: And they, when they had heard that he was alive, and had been seen of her, believed not.

12.text: After that he appeared in another form to two of them, as they walked, and went into the country.

13.text: And they went and told it to the residue: neither believed they them.

14.text: Afterward he appeared to the eleven as they sat at meat, and upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them which had seen him after he was risen.

15.text: And he said to them, Go you into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature.

16.text: He that believes and is baptized shall be saved; but he that believes not shall be damned.

17.text: And these signs shall follow them that believe; In my name shall they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues;

18.text: They shall take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.

19.text: So then after the Lord had spoken to them, he was received up into heaven, and sat on the right hand of God.

20.text: And they went forth, and preached every where, the Lord working with them, and confirming the word with signs following. Amen.
